cards.rules_text:
Whenever you create a token, note that kind of token.
If you would create one or more tokens, you may instead create those tokens plus a token you've noted with this creature.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Originally built for mass production, it gained a taste for life's finer pleasures.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
This artifact enters tapped with eight stun counters on it.
Whenever you cast a noncreature spell, untap this.
{1}, {T}: This deals 2 damage to any target.
{1}, {T}: Draw a card.

Whenever you attack, reveal the top four cards of your library. You may put a historic card from among them into your hand, and the rest on the bottom of your library. [i](Artifacts, legendaries, and Sagas are historic.)[/i]
Whenever another historic permanent you control enters, put a +1/+1 counter on each Artificer you control.

[+1]: Draw a card, then discard a card unless an opponent lost life this turn.
[-2]: Choose target creature you control. When that creature deals combat damage to an opponent this turn, return it to your hand, then you may put a creature card that shares a color with it from your hand onto the battlefield.
cards.special_text:
[+1]: Draw a card, then discard a card unless an opponent lost life this turn.
[-2]: Choose target creature you control. When that creature deals combat damage to an opponent this turn, return it to your hand, then you may put a creature card that shares a color with it from your hand onto the battlefield.

cards.rules_text: Search your library for a basic land card and a creature card and reveal them. Put the basic land onto the battlefield, and the creature card into your hand. Then shuffle.

This spell costs {3} less to cast if it targets a permanent.
Sarkhan's Rebuttal deals 5 damage to any target.
cards.flavor_text: [i]The best points are made in few words.[/i]

cards.rules_text: When this enchantment enters and at the beginning of your upkeep, look at the top seven cards of your library. You may exile a creature card from among them. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order. You may cast that card as long as it remains exiled.
When you cast an instant or sorcery spell, sacrifice this enchantment. If you do, copy that spell. You may choose new targets for the copy.

[+2]: Untap up to two target lands
[-2]: Mill three cards. Then return up to one permanent card or up to three land cards from your graveyard to your hand.
[-9]: Put an animus counter on each of up to three lands you control. They become 4/4 creatures in addition to their other types. They can't attack this turn.

cards.rules_text:
Choose one—
• Counter target spell.
• Search your library for an instant or sorcery card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
cards.flavor_text: [i]“I don't recall you posing a challenge.”[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Choose target permanent you control. Create a token that's a copy of that permanent, except it's legendary.
Retrace [i](You may cast this card from your graveyard by discarding a land card in addition to paying its other costs.)[/i]
During each of your turns, you may cast non-colorless spells with mana value 3 or less from your hand without paying their mana cost if they don't share a color with a spell you've cast this turn.

Haste
When this creature enters, draw a card, then you may put a creature card with mana value 2 or less from your hand onto the battlefield.

Look at the top six cards of your library. Put any number of permanent cards from among them with total mana value 8 or less onto the battlefield. Put the rest on the bottom of your library in a random order.
cards.flavor_text: [i]When a guest of honor arrives to a Cabaretti party, it's hard not to notice.[/i]

cards.rules_text: Look at the top four cards of your library. Put two into your hand, and the rest into your graveyard. You lose 2 life.

Kicker—Discard a creature card [i](You may discard a creature card in addition to any other costs as you cast this spell.)[/i]
All creatures get -1/-1 until end of turn. If this was kicked, they get -X/-X until end of turn instead, where X is the discarded card's power.
cards.notes: Instant or Sorcery sweeper; mana value 2-3

Unfathomable [i](When you cast this, copy it if your starting deck had twenty cards more than the minimum size. Copy it again if it had sixty cards more.)[/i]

Unfathomable [i](When you cast this, copy it if your starting deck had twenty cards more than the minimum size. Copy it again if it had sixty cards more.)[/i]
Draw two cards, then discard a card if this is a copy. Create a tapped Treasure token.

[+2]: Create a Treasure token.
[-1]: Draw two cards, then shuffle a card from your hand into your library.
[-5]: Create a token that's a copy of target permanent you control, except it isn't legendary.

cards.rules_text:
[i](As this enters, choose an opponent to defend it. You and others may attack it. When it is damaged, remove that many counters again unless the defender pays that much life.)[/i]
When this battle enters or is defeated, target opponent discards a card. They lose 2 life unless a nonland card was discarded this way.

[i](As this enters, choose an opponent to defend it. You and others may attack it. When it is damaged, remove that many counters again unless the defender pays that much life.)[/i]
When this battle enters or is defeated, it deals 2 damage to target opponent and up to one target creature they control.

[i](As this enters, choose an opponent to defend it. You and others may attack it. When it is damaged, remove that many counters again unless the defender pays that much life.)[/i]
When this enters or is defeated return another target nonland permanent to its owner's hand. If you controlled it, draw a card.

[i](As this enters, choose an opponent to defend it. You and others may attack it. When it is damaged, remove that many counters again unless the defender pays that much life.)[/i]
When this battle enters or is defeated, put a +1/+1 counter on each creature you control and untap them. They gain vigilance until end of turn.

[i](As this enters, choose an opponent to defend it. You and others may attack it. When it is damaged, remove that many counters again unless the defender pays that much life.)[/i]
When this battle enters or is defeated, you may sacrifice a creature. If you do, search your library for a creature card with mana value equal to 1 plus the sacrificed creature's mana value, put that card onto the battlefield, then shuffle. It gains haste until end of turn.

[i]Delirium[/i] — This spell costs {3} less to cast if there are four or more card types among cards in your graveyard.
Create a tapped 2/2 black Nightmare creature token for each instant and sorcery card in your graveyard.
Search your library for a card, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle. If the revealed card was a planeswalker, each opponent sacrifices a creature.
cards.flavor_text: [i]Jack came to Accordia searching for a God he once knew. When the waking world had no answers, he turned to dreams instead.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
You get a reunion counter, then create X 2/2 red and white Human creature tokens with haste, where X is the number of reunion counters you have.
Put Back to School into its owner's library tenth from the top.
cards.flavor_text: [i]It always had to end where it began.[/i]

cards.rules_text:
Envision [i](As an additional cost to cast this, you may exile cards with at least three unique types among them from your graveyard.)[/i]
Staggering Performance deals 2 damage to any target. If it was envisioned, it deals 4 damage instead.

When Qing Long's Teachings enters the battlefield, search your library for an instant card or a card with flash, reveal it, put it into your hand, then shuffle.
At the beginning of your end step, untap all lands you control.

[i]Big Break

At the beginning of your upkeep, you may draw a card and put an emptiness counter on Trendy Spirituality.
Your maximum hand size is reduced by 1 for each emptiness counter on Trendy Spirituality.
When Oakgrove Agent enters the battlefield, network. [i](You get {V}. As a sorcery, spend 5 {V} to call in a favor.)[/i]

Whenever you cast a spell that targets an opponent or a permanent an opponent controls, put a mastery counter on On the Grind. Then you may have each player lose life equal to the number of mastery counters on On the Grind.

—Cid Ruiz, Ride Genius [/i]
